section.title: Procedure to Deploy ESX Cloud with OVSvApp

listitem.para: Setup your configuration files, as follows:
Copy the example configuration files into the required setup directory and edit them as required:
See a sample set of configuration files in the ~/helion/examples/entry-scale-esx-kvm-vsa directory. The accompanying README.md file explains the contents of each of the configuration files.
Begin inputting your environment information into the configuration files in the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition directory.

note.para: If you want to use a dedicated deployer node in your ESX deployment, add eon-client service-component, to manage vCenter via EON operation from the deployer node, in the control_plane.yml file as shown in the following example.

listitem.screen: clusters: - name: cluster0 cluster-prefix: c0 server-role: HLM-ROLE service-components: - lifecycle-manager - eon-client ...

listitem.para: Commit your cloud deploy configuration to the , as follows:
listitem.screen: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "My config or other commit message"

note.para: This step needs to be repeated any time you make changes to your configuration files before you move onto the following steps. See for more information.
